Problem:
Mark has $50.5 in his bank account. He earns $12.5 per day at his work. If he wants to buy a bike that costs $300.5, how many days does Mark have to save his money?

history.name: assistant
history.content:
The key to solving the problem is to find the difference between the cost of the bike and his current savings. Then, divide this difference by his daily income to find out how many days he needs to work to save enough money. We can solve this problem with Python code directly.

```python
from sympy import *

# define the variables
current_savings = 50.5
daily_income = 12.5
bike_cost = 300.5

# calculate the number of days Mark needs to save money
days_to_save = (bike_cost - current_savings) / daily_income

# round up to the nearest day as Mark will need to work a full day even if he only needs a small part of his daily income
days_to_save = ceiling(days_to_save) 

print(days_to_save)
```

history.name: assistant
history.content: So, Mark has to save his money for \boxed{20} days to buy a bike that costs $300.5.
